data.title: Alvon and Tommy Castro
data.text:
OMG! What great music, and a beautifully refurbished theater!
The drinks served by the bartender were excellent, the seating was comfortable and you could enjoy seeing the stage from all seats! I definitely will be back!
Thanks for a great time, Mo

data.title: A True Gem Hidden in Vallejo
data.text: Looking for some awesome entertainment at an affordable price?  Then the Empress Theatre is definitely place to add to your list.  This facility offers a variety of entertainment ranging from comedy night specials to amazing concerts.  I recently attended a spectacular tribute to Prince ... beyond sensational!

data.title: Excellent downtown Vallejo experience!
data.text: This small, local theater always turns out the greatest classic movies, local talent and special events.  It is like going to S.F. for a theater experience without the high cost.  You can have beverages before the shows and during the intermissions.  A real jewel of a local experience!

data.title: Great Art Deco theater from my youth
data.text:
This beautiful old theater has been in Vallejo for since 1911.  It used to house a huge Wurlitzer pipe organ for silent movies and has EXCELLENT acoustics.  It conveniently has a full bar attached to the side too.  I've lived in Vallejo all my life and been here many times to see different shows.  House of FLoyd is a spectacular experience including laser lighting that rivals the original Pink Floyd. They have comedy shows as well as movie nights.  Every week is the groovemasters and special artists play on Wednesdays. For dancing it can be Tommy Castro, Raymond Victor or Alan with the Island Grove band. I'm still waiting for the return of the Time Bandits though.

I guess I should mention it is inexpensive with many shows going for $10

data.title: Absolutely Wonderful.
data.text: There's a band and cocktail hour before the movie, the theater itself is beautiful and the staff is wonderful.

data.title: Great inexpensive entertainment.
data.text: They have great music and comedy at rock bottom prices. Refurbished theater and run by volunteers. Well done! Sometimes the music is a little too loud, but that could be fixed. If that weren't a problem my review would be 5...

data.title: Beautiful Venue
data.text: I love attending events here.  It is a beautiful restoration of a great old theater and the acoustics are wonderful!

data.title: A beautifully restored venue!
data.text: The Empress is a true jewel in Vallejo.  The restoration of this venue is amazing.  It is a much larger venue than you would expect from the street. The prices are always affordable. For those of us of a certain age, it truly brings back memories.  I have seen bands perform, comedians, live theater and even old movies are shown.  I encourage you to make a plan to come to the Empress in Vallejo for one of their performances you won't regret it.

data.title: Quality Acts for Low Low Price
data.text:
Great acts coming into The Empress! What else can you do on a Wednesday night for a very very low price! Blues, Rock and Roll,
50s and 60s and more!

data.title: A Restored Jewel
data.text: The Empress Theater hosts many types of music events.  The theatre has been beautifully restored.  A new sound system has been installed that is state of the art.  We have been to Vallejo Jazz Society events, Kevin Russell's Cream of Clapton, and to hear local musicians. For all events the pricing is very reasonable and the experience has always been very good.

data.title: Beautiful historic theater with great shows at excellent prices.
data.text: We have enjoyed a few concerts at the Empress over the last several years. It holds less than 600 people and has an attached bar and restaurant that we haven't visited. The ticket prices are rarely over $30 and often $15. Free parking is right across the street. They also show movies and have other events.

data.title: Beautiful Historic Theatre.
data.text: We went to a free concert by the SF Chamber orchestra,the seats are very comfortable the acoustics are good and the decor very attractive.There is good parking available.there is public transportation.It is a real gem located in downtown Vallejo.

data.title: Decent historical venue
data.text: Nice acoustics, atmosphere, and friendly staff. This is a rather odd thing to find in an otherwise desolate, and culturally starved downtown area.

data.title: Fun and beautiful 1930s theater
data.text: Restored to perfection,  Music Fantastic. Wed. night ramble is beyond good. Best 10 bucks in the whole Bay Area

data.title: Empress Theatre
data.text: This is a 100 year old restored theatre that I went to in the 60's.  It has been restored to be a beautiful theatre.  It has things happening there a lot of nights during the week from famous singers to old movies to blues concerts.  There is usually wine and beer available.

data.title: Historic Building  (yes) Today's Music (yes)
data.text: The Theatre stood vacant for many years but remodeling restored the beautiful interior to house a modern taste for musical events most weekends and Wednesday's Ramble.

data.title: Wonderful Old Art Deco with a Modern Twist
data.text:
We are semi-regulars at the Empress for live music.  We love live music.  We love the Empress.  We love the fact that they have a bar, which is unusual in such venues.

When we lived in Antioch we had El Campanil.  Now that we reside in Vallejo, we have the Empress.  It is a wonderful experience!

There is a "regular" crowd there but they make you feel welcome.  It's very diverse which adds great flavor to the venue.  They have an awsome dance floor and, with the bands we've seen - Mark Hummel, Tom Rigney & Flambeau, Danny Click, Tommy Castro, the North Bay Allstars and various other Bay Area based greats, the dance floor was filled and rockin'.

Parking is easy.  There are a few bars and restaurants nearby.  We predict that downtown Vallejo will rise again, in no small part due to the Empress and the audiences it attracts.

Give it a shot, keep an open mind and, have a great time.  There is no better place for live music at this price point in the Bay Area and we attend quite a few.

data.title: In Support of the Empress
data.text: History is important in Vallejo.  We have a lot of it and it has gifted us with some glowing examples of the value of preserving history.  I recently attended a live boxing event at the Empress Theater that was put on by the PAL boxing organization in Vallejo.  This was a well done, well-prepared-for event that showcase what a wonderful venue the Empress Theater is.  A very ornate venue, clean, well-attended-to and ready to serve a number of types of event.  We should make the Empress Theater a stronger part of Vallejo's representation.

data.title: This is the " feel good place" that is beautiful venue.
data.text:
The Empress Theatre is 103 years old, renovated in 2006/2007. Since re-opening in 2008, the Empress has brought in some amazing local and regional talent. Musicians from the Bay Area, National and International, documentarians, Bay Area Stage Productions for stage plays, the San Francisco Chamber Orchestra, the Vallejo Symphony, benefit concerts for many good causes.
We have a fantastic theatre manager, Don Bassey whom is a bay are musician for over 30 years.
Always a good time and always great entertainment!!

data.title: The New Addams Family
data.text: Beautiful old theater in the heart of old town Vallejo. We went to see a friends play last weekend and were pleasantly charmed at the quaint location. Look forward to seeing another event there again.
